questions_and_notes: Don't think "time: mean within hours time: maximum over hours" is CF compliant; only "within days" or "within years". I assume this is the absolute maximum hourly rate for the entire month; is that correct?  Note that in general "area: mean" will give a lower maximum if data are mapped to a coarser grid than the original.
specific_issues: 8:Deprecate? Only 1 groups contributed this variable in CMIP6.
cell_methods: area: mean time: mean (for each hour of the day) time: maximum (hourly rate within each month)
comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
